head.title: Wedding in Italy For Lisa Phillips

hedline.hl1: Wedding in Italy For Lisa Phillips

block.p: LEAD: The marriage of Lisa Phillips, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Warren H. Phillips of Bridgehampton, L.I., to Meyer Vaisman, a son of Mr. and Mrs. David Vaisman of Caracas, Venezuela, took place yesterday. The ceremony was performed at the Villa Pisani-Ferri in Vicenza, Italy, by Magistrate Francesco Rimini.

LEAD: The marriage of Lisa Phillips, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Warren H. Phillips of Bridgehampton, L.I., to Meyer Vaisman, a son of Mr. and Mrs. David Vaisman of Caracas, Venezuela, took place yesterday. The ceremony was performed at the Villa Pisani-Ferri in Vicenza, Italy, by Magistrate Francesco Rimini.

The marriage of Lisa Phillips, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Warren H. Phillips of Bridgehampton, L.I., to Meyer Vaisman, a son of Mr. and Mrs. David Vaisman of Caracas, Venezuela, took place yesterday. The ceremony was performed at the Villa Pisani-Ferri in Vicenza, Italy, by Magistrate Francesco Rimini.
Julie Sylvester and Peter Halley were the maid of honor and best man.

The bride, who will keep her name, is a curator at the Whitney Museum of American Art in New York. She graduated from Middlebury College. Her father is chairman of Dow Jones & Company, publishers of The Wall Street Journal. Her mother, Barbara Phillips, is a writer. The bridegroom, a painter, graduated from the Parsons School of Design. His father is the retired president of Astrolite Industries, luggage makers in Caracas.
